description: {"blocks":[{"key":"8koar","text":"This protocol was developed as a high throughput, low cost technique to perform phage display immunopreceipitation. Here we overview all the steps, from isolating antibodies from a complex matrix of patient sample, washing the sample and amplify targets through two rounds of selection. steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"altmh","text":"Make blocking solution to prevent sample and library from binding to plates, this step also helps with movement of protein A/G beads later on. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"borks","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6hkbo","text":"        Blocking solution (make fresh for every experiment):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2tpa2","text":"            3.0% BSA Fraction V","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2k1r4","text":"            1x TBS-Tween","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fmhb6","text":"            Mix thoroughly and filter through a 0.22um filter","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cvfsf","text":"After plates have sufficiently blocked, unseal plates and discard all blocking solution contained in one set of IP plates by dumping the contents into the sink and gently tapping on clean paper towels. Continue blocking the other set of plates for round two of IP. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1ph0d","text":"Add   of phage library per well. If a canary well is desired (to control for phage contamination of reagents and during the protocol) add SM buffer to that well instead of phage library.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"F6AC6500DA8911EBA9E7F9DBBCD6766E","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6tq59","text":"Add sample to library, amounts vary depending on sample type and concentration of IgG in sample:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"10vi2","text":"  of serum OR plasma in 1x Storage Buffer ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c2bel","text":"  of CSF in 1x Storage Buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5kctp","text":"  of Commercial Antibody (for positive control, recommend to put one of these on each plate randomized location.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f4q4n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ansar","text":"A highly recommended sample type is an AG control well (\"mock-IP\") with no sample to control for nonspecific binding of phage library to A/G beads. Recommended to put 2 - 4 of these on each plate and randomize the location. {"blocks":[{"key":"e2537","text":"After final/5th wash drain liquid, turn off and release vacuum pressure, and add 150uL LB-Carb to each well. {"blocks":[{"key":"b9d95","text":"Remove supernatant and immediately add cold TNP40 again. Mix overhead again. Repeat this wash step a total of three times to fully remove the solution that the beads were stored in. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fd4ch","text":"On the final wash step, elute the beads in enough TNP40 for the number of reactions needed. From experience, eluting in   per reaction works well to form a nice droplet with the wide bore tips when adding beads to the peptidome and sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":120,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"25","error":false,"guid":"415D55F0DA8A11EBA9E7F9DBBCD6766E","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

steps.section: Day 2- Adding Beads to Sample Bound to Library Targets
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9a8or","text":"Put washed A/G beads into a reservoir container.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5d9sj","text":"Add A/G beads to sample/library plate with wide bore tips using a multichannel quickly, making sure the beads stay resuspended and do not settle on the bottom of the reservoir.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ejdfd","text":"Seal plate with foil seal. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"efj1a","text":"Overhead mix for    at .","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":18,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":22,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8mka8","text":"NOTE: Don't exceed 1 hour, more time will increase nonspecific binding. (50min-1hr of bead binding is okay; start first group of plates at 50 mins) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"417136A0DA8B11EBA9E7F9DBBCD6766E","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"47196CD0DA8B11EBA9E7F9DBBCD6766E","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

steps.section: Day 2- Adding Beads to Sample Bound to Library Targets
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4mfiq","text":"Simultaneously, prepare new E.coli culture by growing 1-3mL of the overnight culture in enough LB-Carb (0.5mL for each sample).","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"72g6m","text":"Prepare vacuum plates with labels and vacuum manifold.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a1vs2","text":"Recommend to label plates as Plate 1 Round 1, Plate 2 Round 1, etc. to keep track steps during the immunoprecipitation washes.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d8uvb","text":"Seal plate very well (should be able to see outline of the individual wells) with foil seal and plastic plate sealer tool. {"blocks":[{"key":"1couc","text":"Using a 12-channel P1000 multichannel, gently mix and transfer   of mixture to the corresponding row on labeled 96 well filter plate that is placed on the vacuum manifold with the vacuum OFF. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1vao","text":"Turn vacuum off, GENTLY/SLOWLY release the vacuum pressure to avoid tearing the filter membranes. If you accidentally touch tips to plate, discard and use new tips.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":124,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4o0e7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"7AD4C9C0DA9511EBA9E7F9DBBCD6766E","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"7F855980DA9511EBA9E7F9DBBCD6766E","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fdvd7","text":"Place plate on rocker for   -   such that the liquid is freely moving in the wells.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":26,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":30,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5e73q","text":"If doing more than one set of plates, begin on the next set of two plates while the first pair incubates on the rocker.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4316k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ec5r2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":420,"guid":"FD7E6500A34611EC81A5A95908528853","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"10D20E90A34711EC81A5A95908528853","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8rtb","text":"After   -  , spin the plates for   for  ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":6,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":10,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":33,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":39,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5i5ng","text":"Place on vacuum manifold and turn on vacuum to half power, let liquid just drain through, turn off the vacuum and add   RIPA to each well while hovering above the wells.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":118,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":420,"guid":"265D1DA3A34711EC891F0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"265D1F02A34711EC891F0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"centrifuge":"800","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"32810D40DA9611EBA9E7F9DBBCD6766E","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}},"3":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":20,"guid":"38B752A0DA9611EBA9E7F9DBBCD6766E","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"4":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"561AF950DA9611EBA9E7F9DBBCD6766E","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8u1bf","text":"Seal with a gas permeable seal, and incubate in shaker incubator for 1-2 hrs.
